name: Flying with Billy Bishop Walking Tour

location.name: Start Point - Southwest corner of Queens Quay West and Eireann Quay

description:
Explore the history of Billy Bishop Toronto City Airport and discover how it has connected Toronto to the world and contributed to Toronto’s aviation history in its over 85 years of flight.

This 1.1 kilometre-long tour was developed and will be led by Shannon Buskermolen. Shannon is an Emerging Historian and former Programs Assistant with Heritage Toronto, who recently completed a graduate certificate program in Museum and Cultural Management at Centennial College. Shannon holds a double MA in International War Studies from University College Dublin and the University of Potsdam, and a BA Honours in Anthropology and History from Trent University.

name: Unapologetic Dance Company Presents - "In Their Time II"
description:
A visceral continuation of the journey that began with 2022’s "In Their Time".

Blending that raw emotion with the deep introspection of Sentience, and the quiet interconnection of SONDER, this fourth full-length production weaves memory, movement, and meaning into a living, breathing legacy.

Through honest movement and fearless artistry, "In Their Time II" honours the scars, celebrates the triumphs, and reclaims the narratives that shape us.

This is more than a dance production, it’s a reclamation of self, a tribute to resilience, and a testament to the power of movement to heal, connect, and transform.

name: Lake Shore West Garden Tour

location.name: Long Branch, Alderwood, New Toronto and Mimico

description: You’re invited to visit a collection of unique and private gardens in West Lakeshore neighbourhoods. Most gardens are hosted by the gardeners so you can ask questions. More information including garden locations and events will be available in May and June.

name: Cyanotype Printmaking Workshop

location.name: High Park Nature Centre Forest School

description:
Note: Pre-registration is required for all our events, hikes and workshops. We do this to ensure we don’t exceed our capacity for indoor events or the maximum limits for group sizes on High Park’s ecologically sensitive trails. 

Please join us for a delightful afternoon of Cyanotype Printmaking! In this hands-on workshop, you will be creating a collection of eight original prints inspired from nature at High Park. The instructor, Alan Li, will also explain how you can continue creating Cyanotype prints year-round at home. No previous experience is required, just bring your curiosity and enthusiasm!

Paper, cyanotype printmaking, and other all other art supplies will be provided.

name: Community Environment Day at L'Amoreaux Community Recreation Centre
description:
Join Councillor Mantas (Ward 22) and the City of Toronto to help reduce the amount of waste going to landfill. Drop off household items for donation, electronics for reuse or recycling and household hazardous waste for proper disposal. 

Pick up free bagged compost while supplies last and kitchen catchers for organics ($7 each – cash, debit and credit accepted).

name: Beading Workshop with Jessica McKenzie at Todmorden Mills

address.streetAddress: MJPR+78 Todmorden Mills Park, 67 Pottery Rd

description:
Learn and appreciate the Indigenous tradition of beading, with the guidance and support of Cree bead artist and Miss Indigenous Canada, Jessica McKenzie.
Craft your own piece of beaded art and learn about the importance of passing down culture from generation to generation. Weave bead by bead, and feel connected to the history and significance of the beading craft in Indigenous communities.

Jessica McKenzie is a proud member of Opaskwayak Cree Nation living in Toronto, ON. She is a sister, auntie, step-mother, entrepreneur and beadwork artist. With her love for community, she encourages cultural revitalization through traditional beading workshops.

name: Creating Toronto Walking Tour

location.name: Start and End Point - South-end of Market Lane Park

description:
Explore the hidden gems of the St. Lawrence Neighbourhood, once the old Town of York. Learn how remnants from the early city connect to today’s bustling metropolis.

This tour is approximately 1.8 kilometers in distance and takes place predominantly on paved city sidewalks and streets. There are some unpaved portions of the route that take place in city parks.

name: Between the Grooves - Comedy Inspired by an Album
description:
An improvised exploration of an entire album - this one's for lovers of music and comedy! This stacked cast of comedy heroes will unpack each track on the album to inspire scenes that will move you, figuratively and literally.

Come watch some of the funniest improvisers in Canada will bring the album to life, one song at a time! This time, Rihanna's album ANTI.

name: Can You Feel It?
description:
Experience a concert to ignite the senses with vibrant sound and movement. The senior choir - the internationally-acclaimed Chamber Choir - will be touring this summer to an international festival, and starting in Toronto!

New commissions by Jude Roldan of the Philippines and Laura Jekobsone of Latvia. Other works include "Stars", accompanied by tuned wine glasses by Ēriks Ešenvalds, "Singkap Siaga" by Tracy Wong with choreography from Malaysia, and "Abendlied" Josef Rheinberger's choral masterpiece. Conducted by Zimfira Poloz.

name: Port Union Waterfront Festival

address.streetAddress: Port Union Village Common Park, 105 Bridgend St

description: Enjoy a vibrant annual festival packed with live entertainment, exciting children’s activities, a bustling craft market, and unique vendor displays! Bring the whole family for a day of fun, community spirit, and discovery. Delicious food will be available for purchase at a nominal cost. Don't miss out on this unforgettable celebration!
